The First Bedouin has a gentle face. He is scared. Troy and Swoff can’t understand. More Bedouin emerge, eig of them now, This is getting very tense. The First Bedoui slowly reaches for Swoff‘s rifle, trying to show him something. Swoff pushes him back. The First Bedouin turns Troy for help, gesturing. TROY (cont'd) Give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Give it to him. He wants tc show us something. Swoff unloads his rifle, then hands it to the Bedouin, wh takes the weapon the way a child might, points it at the camels and makes firing noises. Troy and Swoff lock at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF

He reaches out to help the Bedovin check the bolt. The Bedouin hasn‘t opened the rifle and doesn't want to give back. Revised Ist Draft - 4/20/04

SWOFF (cont'd) That‘s good. Good. He opens up the bolt so that the Bedouin can check the chamber. SWOFF (cont'd) See? It clearly hasn't been fired. The First Bedouin nods to Swoff, turns and speaks in Arabic to the other Bedouin. T tension dissolves. The First Bedouin hands the rifle back Swoff and nods in respect. Swoff nods back.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Hey man, we're sorry about your camels-- The Bedouin nods to Troy as well, then walks away. The others follow, back to the camels. Swoff and Troy watch t go.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: I wonder what dumb fuck played target practice with their camels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should sec what -ne 40 does to the head of a fucking camel. * Troy and Swoff share a look. Of course. Who else but Fowl would have shot the camels?

dialogues.speaker: FOWLER
dialogues.text: It turns it inside out into about three fucking knots. Easy targets too. Head shots like a motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: TROY

dialogues.speaker: FOWLER
dialogues.text: You just haven't got to kill anything, that’s your problem. As they talk a Mercedes Sedan approaches from the rear. I floats back behind them, waiting to pass. In front is an upper-class ARAB, in the back seat a veiled ARAB WOMAN. FOWLER (cont'd) Check this out! , As the Mercedes passes, Fowler stands up, helds the cross with one hand, and pulls his other hand to his mouth, flicking his tongue between his fingers in an obscene gesture. Swoff can see the covered woman alone in the back of the Mercedes. He watches as her eyes follow Fowler’s crude gesture. He sees her eyes, locked on Fowler, register sho confusion, disgust. Swoff stares as the Mercedes blows past. FOWLER (cont‘d) That bitch will never forget me. She wanted me. swoff stares at Fowler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swofif tries to sleep. Ze tosses and turns. We go in on h face Revised ist Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bizarre, empty city-scape. A de Chirico painting. Swoff wanders through it. The alleys are numerous, the women in them wear veils. All he sees is their eyes. Diseased dogs wander, addicts do drugs. The sound of his footsteps on pavement. A veiled woman approaches. He sees her eyes above the vei It is Kristina. He tries to approach her but can get no closer. She turns and heads out of the alley. Swoff follo her. Swoff turns out of the alley and he is in a giant reticle Someone else’s crosshairs. Light floods in. A shot rings out. Swoff is shot through the eye. He holds his hand up his face. No blood. Where the eye was is a small black ho Fowler spray paints Swoff’s name on a warhead. It fires, streaming missile, it comes down, headed straight for him right into him and... a@ Mercedes speeds by. Siek is driving. Kristina is in th back seat. Staring at him, she lifts the veil, which beco the T-shirt in the photograph. She takes it off, revealin her body which is shriveled like a mummy. Swoff begins to cough, then choke. He vomits. Sand pours of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swoff comes awake, sweating. He runs his tongue around hi lips, tries to swallow. Shit. He lies back down, his eyes open. We hear howitzers firing in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swoff and Troy man a .50 Cal sniper rifle set up on the r Swoff is on the radio while Troy idly scans with the nigh vision binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: It’s been weeks since anybody complained about this place.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (shrugs) It’s home now. It‘s comfortable. Revised lst Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: om)

dialogues.speaker: SWOFE
dialogues.text: - guess you can get used to anything.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: At least it’s about to hit the fan. I’m so fucking bored.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Scout-snipers, man. We lead the way.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: You’re supposed to be the fucking smart one. Wake up. What can we shoot, Say, out to 1500 yards? Man, in Vietnam, that was, what, a week? In Worid War I, a year? Here it’s going to be about ten fucking seconds. By the time we dial in our rifles the fucking war is going to be a mile down the road.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: What're you saying, we’re not going to get any kills?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Face facts, man. Swoff stares at him, not believing gung-ho Troy is saying this. Then Troy sees something through his binoculars. TROY (cont'd) Hey, check this out. Swoff moves the scope over to look.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SCOPE
dialogues.text: An office, with a map on the wall. A Marine is updating i

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: The fucking General's office. Swoff moves the rifle. The GENERAL appears, in the reticl looking very impatient, gesturing to a COLONEL. Swoff'’s finger twitches on the trigger. Revised Ist Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWCFF (cont’d) Bang. The General and the Colonel head out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Don’t even think about it. Swoff moves the scope around the room and stops on 4 Television.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Look, the fucker’s got CNN. The TV is set to CNN: A REPORTER is broadcasting news of SCUD attack in Israel. We see a smoking ruin, civilians i gas masks. Troy begins to read the ticker-tape along the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (reading, slowly) Secretary of Defense Cheney sends Delta Ferce to look for Scuds... Just then the Marine who was updating the map checks to m sure the officers have left, then changes the channel: it now MTV. Madonna does “Vogue.”

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Isn’t that Madonna?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Back to the map. They both move their scopes back to the map. We see it mo clearly now. TROY (cont’d) It’s the Sit Map, the real thing. Everything they’re not fucking telling us. They lower their eye pieces, stare at each other. Holy sh Then they both look again. 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snipers gather around a map they’ve made up to be the exact duplicate of the general's. Troy finishes up some markings based on notes he has in his hand, then turns to start explaining it to the other snipers. Swoff sits stil and silent. All this is getting to him. Revised lst Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Cxay, here we are, First Mar Div. Just South of the oil fields in South Kuwait fifty miles inland. The Second's directly to our west. This is ovr planned line of assault. They stare at it, each imagining the shit hitting the fan TROY (cont’d) Here's the math. On the infantry level, we’re outnumbered three to one. Escobar whistles softly. The men look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: What‘s that, there, in front of our assault route?

dialogues.speaker: VEGH
dialogues.text: Iraqi artillery...13,14,15 battalions. We’ve got three.

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: And look. An Iraqi armored brigade- -state of the art Soviet tanks. West, to east, across the middle of Kuwait. And an armored division, just south of the oil fields. Right in front of us. They're all quiet for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: I hear they shipped in a hundred thousand body bags. This sinks in on Swoff. He has a feeling of impending doo

dialogues.speaker: ESCOBAR
dialogues.text: Do they come in sizes? (beat) Seriously, man. I mean Welty, you could fit two of him in Kuehn’s bag.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What difference does it make?

dialogues.speaker: ESCOBAR
dialogues.text: i just want a good fit. Revised ist Draft - 4/20/04  b4

dialogues.text: No wrinkles, richt, .° -k?

dialogues.text: Fucking A, someone's gotta look good.

dialogues.text: (suddenly exploding) You're just dead, stinking up the cargo plane, man, stinking it up with dead fucking you and all the other dead fucking jarheads. Maybe some of us, who the fuck knows. That's why we wear these... (he holds out his dog tag) We know who the fuck we are when we're alive...This is death man, death around our necks...we got death around our necks. They all stare at Swoff. For a moment no one knows what t Bay.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: That‘s deep.

dialogues.speaker: KUERN
dialogues.text: Too many books, man. Screws up your head.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (after a moment, practical) Dog tag check. They all start checking their dog tags. Swoff has one aro his neck, one in the loop of his boot. This is the standa style, but there are many variations. Troy’s are painted Marine Corps green; Welty’s shit brown. Escobar has four taped together and wrapped with camouflage desert tape. Vegh starts picking something off his.

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: What the hell’s that? It's a hair, a very curly hair Vegh has taped to his tags

dialogues.text: They ..axes them ali laugh, especially with the accent. Fine _y even Swoff starts to smile. He picks up a letter Opens it. Some pictures fall out. He looks at’ them befor reads the letter.

dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.text: What‘s up? Swoff hands him the pictures. One of them looks’ like a p His mother is in white next to a beardless round-faced ma @ white tuxedo. . In another shot he is kissing Swoff’s mother.

dialogues.text: What does this look like to you? Troy looks through the pictures, shuffles them back and forth, returns once or twice to one of them.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Hell Swoff, looks to me like your mom just married some fat dude.

dialogues.text: My mom married some guy I don’t even know. She could have waited until I died in the fucking war or made it home alive, don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: We're jarheads, man. Nobody gives a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. She's my mother and she married a stranger. She made me a step son and I had nothing to say about it. What if I don't like the motherfucker?

dialogues.text: Swoffie, it's not really your business. Your mom fell in love, she got married. You're a grown man, she’s a grown woman. Sne couldn't wait. (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a TROY (cont'd) Time doesn't stop back in the world man, just because we're about to be ir the shit. Nothing stays the same, not our mothers, not our girlfriends, not nobody. They live their lives, man.

dialogues.text: I know you’re a jarhead. That's all I need to know. (beat) Jar-fucking-head. (beat) Marine Corps Birthday? (beat) Marine Corps Birthday, goddamnit!

You shitbags dishonor the memory of Chesty Puller every day with your lazy asses lying around on these cots Like god damned desert princes jerking your rotten clits. (beat) Bends and thrusts. Bends and thrusts. My Hungarian grandmother’s harder than you Swofford! The tension explodes. They pretend to be ODIs to each oth The whole hooch is on the floor doing push-ups and squat thrusts. Someone knocks the foreboding map over. Revised Ist Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Kuehn go back and forth, pointing fingers in ea others faces, impersonating their favorite DI's, the ones they hated the most, the same ones who taught them the mo Someone begins to bend heavy wire. As the wire is bent, a blow torch appears. As the thrashing goes on we CUT back forth to see the wire as it is heated up. The others head butt and chest-slam each other. Now the wire glows red hot. As the tension reaches its pe Troy shouts.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Now! Now! Now! They grab Swoff and hold him down. He looks and sees the brand... They’re all around, yelling. The brand comes dow Swoff’s face as it touches his skin. He screams. Then his face slowly changes from rage and pa to a kind of acceptance.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I no longer care that my mother has completed the crucifixion of my family and married someone I‘ve never met. I have a new family. We linger on Swoff as Troy grabs him and holds him.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Semper fi, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: We turn the inside of our hooch into a circus and inside of the circus we cannot be injured. Inside ef our circus we cannot be touched. The chaos continues all around him. SWOFF (V.0.) (cont’d) But we are insane to believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total confusion. Trucks grind gears. Tank engines scream, their tracks churning sand. Tents are struck. The whole battalion is mounting up on trucks and Humvees and riding tanks. Revised Ist Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By In full gear, Swoff and the snipers climb into their Humv

dialogues.speaker: C SWOFF
dialogues.text: The United States Congress supports the President's demand for offensive action against Saddam Hussein. The last ultimatum is issued. We move to the Kuwaiti border. The war is so close we can taste it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swoff and his team get out of their Humvee. We are just b a tall berm that marks the Kuwaiti border,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Seik speaks to the STA platoon. He has a laminat briefing sheet in his hands. The men are edgy and nervous

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT SIEK
dialogues.text: Listen up numb nuts. I’ve been ordered to read you what Mister Sedom Insane has just said to the Iraqi people. Please do not c consider this a bunch of bullshit. (reading) “The mother of all battles is upon us. The sacrifices the Iraqi people will make are equal to the importance of the victory. Kuwait is the branch that must be returned to the tree. The blood of infidels will flow like a river. Jihad is the way of all Arab people.” He pronounces jihad as jye-had.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: What the fuck is jye-had?

dialogues.speaker: KOEHN
dialogues.text: It means he thinks they can kick our asses with the help of Allah. We are the sinners. We are the infidels and thus easily defeated due to our sinning and other pad behavior. Revised lst Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been sinning since I was fourteen. They don’t know that in America sinning makes you strong.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT SIEK
dialogues.text: We are now Operation Desert Storm, and we are the eye of the storm. We are the fucking righteous hammer of God. That sinks in. They all stare away, into themselves. SERGEANT SIEK (cont'd) Pass out the syringes. Welty starts to pass out syringes. Swoff takes his. SERGEANT SIEK (cont'd) We don’t know when we'll be going in. We do know there will be gas and it will be fucking nasty. These here are Atropine Oxime injectors that go with your PB pill paks. In the event that you’re attacked by nerve agents such as Somad, those agents will produce immediate casualties if you do not deploy these counter measures most Rikki Tik.

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: Why the fuck have we already taken one cycle of PB and we‘re just now being issued the Atropine and Oxime injectors?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT SIEK
dialogues.text: (eyes rolling) Shut the fuck up, Kuehn.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFE
dialogues.text: They don’t want any chemically dead fighters on CNN.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT SIEK
dialogues.text: In 1987 Sodom Insane used chemical weapons on the Kurds. Killed thousands of them, like fucking that. (snaps fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised ist Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERGEANT SIEK (cont'd) The ones that didn’t die, their fucking new pabies are deformed: eight tees to a foot, mz “nal openings, retarded, blina--such fucked up iittle fuckers it would be better just to kill them. You want that, don’t take the pills. You don't want that... (beat ) «..take the fucking pills! There's silence as that sinks in. We are on Swoff.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. STIEK
dialogues.text: So. Remove one pill from your PB pack. Now place the pill on your tongue. (they do) Take your canteen from you~ belt and swallow water and pill. {they do) Now don't you feel better? Kuehn turns, spits his pill out and kicks sand over it.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT SIEK
dialogues.text: Now dig in. Dig your holes with the hands God gave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of E-tools striking wet sand. Thump. Scrape. Thump. Scrape. It’s a percussive rhythm. swoff and Troy are well down into their fighting hole. To the rear, American howitzers fire. Boom. Boom. Adding deep bass to the percussive concert. Planes fly overhead. Kuehn pokes his head up from the next hole.

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: (re: the howitzers) Soften those ragheads up!

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: They better. I hear the Iraqis have brought their big arty up. Russian stuff. 175‘s, 8 inchers, even bigger. Gas warheads.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Forget the gas. Revised ist Draft ~ 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the gas? Are you nuts?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Can you do a fucking thing about it? (beat) Then forget it.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Doesn’t feel like digging a hole. Feels like digging a grave.

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: Then make it deeper, you fat fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swoff and Troy are peeing and watching bombs explode acro the horizon. We hear the distant rumble of explosions lik thunder and see flashes, strobe-like, across the whole li of Iraqi positions.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Those poor fuckers. Troy pulls a flask of whiskey from his cargo pocket. TROY . The real stuff. I've been saving it for the shit. Swoff takes a long drink. He passes the flask back.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: I didn’t think it would happen. All those deadlines. All that talk. It‘s a real mother-fucking war. Bombs and shit. Chemical weapons. (beat) Welcome to the mother-fucker. Troy takes a long swig. A LOW SCREAMING SOUND comes across the sky, taking us to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swoff and Troy are in their hole, eating breakfast. The SCREAMING SOUND intensifies. Troy and Swoff look at each other. What the fuck is that? Revised ist Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT SIEK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Incoming!!! For a moment we linger on Troy and Swoff and then the pen drops. BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! They throw themselves face down incoming rounds EXPLODE all around them like fierce, blaz fists. We see the effects of the incoming in quick cuts.

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: (yelling) Fuck this goddamn shit! oh fuck god I love my wife! Welty is laughing and shrieking. Cortez and Escobar screa in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: I didn't do it! I didn’t do it!

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Rockets! Rockets! Swoff lies crying out to his mother. They all do, to Mom Jesus. The men’s screams continue over the sounds of the rounds coming in. The sand, where the rounds have impacte looks like an abstract charcoal portrait. Swoff stares over to where his flak jacket, helmet, weapo and gas mask are stacked by his ‘fighting hole. More roun come in.

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: Gas! Gas! Gas! \ Troy and Swoff exchange a look. More rounds explode. Do they die from the explosions or the gas?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Fuck. In the midst of the explosions, Troy crawls out of the ho and grabs the gas masks. Sand rains down. Swoff and Troy desperately don and clear their gas masks. It‘s crazy, disjointed, scary. We hear the sound of Swoff breathing inside his gas mask and the sound of his breathing become the sound of his crying. . SWOFF (V.0.) (cont'd) I‘m not crying because I'm afraid, although I am scared shitiess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised ist Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWOFF (V.O.) (cont'd) I’m crying because I’m finally in combat. My combat action has commenced. Suddenly there is an eerie silence. Swoff rolls over and looks down at himself. To his surprise he has pissed all over himself. Great gou of piss, soaking his trousers, his socks, his bceots. SWOFF (cont ‘d) (to himself) Jesus. Troy shouts to the others.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Everyone okay?

dialogues.speaker: KUEHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we could've not been. We could've not been. Sergeant Siek jumps into their position, gas mask on.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT SIEK
dialogues.text: We've got to find their fucking

dialogues.speaker: F.O.
dialogues.text: His voice comes oddly muddled. Théy stare at Siek through their gas masks. He rips his gas mask off. SERGEANT SIEK (cont‘d} Their fucking F.O.! He’s got us dialed in! We've got to spot him. More rounds come down.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Our radio’s dead. We couldn’t call it in.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT SIEK
dialogues.text: Go to the comm shack. Get some batteries. Swoff stares across the desert.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: It’s a long way away.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: Tu's 2CC meters. Revised lst Draft - 4/20/04

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run tactically. “c-~ ail your gear. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swoff doesn’t move. SERGEANT SIEK (cont‘d)} It ain't gonna get any closer.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, BERM
dialogues.text: Geared up, Swoff pulls on his gas mask and starts to run. He's not twenty yards from the hole when we hear a shout.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Incoming! Rounds explode. We hear screams from wounded. Shouts of “Corpsman! Corpsmen up! Jesus!” Welty heads out with his Unit One. In the b.g. we see him treating a screaming wounded Marine. Swoff runs, his feet slipping in the sand, breathing hard _the sand falling around him. He trips, falls into the sa gets up, runs again. It’s amazingly slow.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF
dialogues.text: (to himself) Bo not die now. Do not die now. Rounds explode all around him. American jets scream over, headed for the Iragi artillery.

And the strangest thing about it is... Sweating and exhausted, they crest a dune. Suddenly they it, a sight unlike anything anyone has ever seen. Revised lst Draft - 4/20/04  SWOFF (V.O.) (cont'd) -+-you never know which way you're walking until you're there.

Hundreds of destroyed Iragi vehicles, both military and civilian, line the side of the road, frozen in destructio they tried to flee. The men move into it, speechless. They stop. dialogues.text: As Swoff crests the rise, he sees the remains of a bombed Iraqi convoy» Twelve vehicles are in a circle. Bodies are gathered around what must have been a campfire. They are burned to a black crisp. Swoff stops and stares, taking i the horror of it. A few men are dead in the cabs of the trucks. The hatch of one troop carrier is open. It is packed with bodies. The men around the fire are bent forward at the waist, sitting dead on large steel ammo boxes. The bodies are in same positions that Swoff's buddies were in just moments before. On either side are blackened bomb depressions lik the marks a fist would make in clay. Swoff vomits. And again, swishing it around in his mouth if to cover the stink and taste of death. Swoff walks to the fire circle. There is a vacant ammunit box, as if reserved for him. He spits into the fire hole, the last of the bile in his mouth. He takes out his crackers. Six tin coffee cups sit among remains of the fire. The men’s boots are cooked to their feet. The man to Swoff’s right has no head. To his left, the man’s head 1s between his legs, his arms hang at his side. Insects swarm.

dialogues.speaker: SWOFF, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I want to ask the dead men their names and identification numbers and tell them this will end soon. They must have questions for me. ‘MORE} Revised Ist Draft - 4/20/04

They think they’re still alive in order to return home and make money and fuck their wife and get drunk and wave the flag. And above them is the night sky, lit by burning wells, crisscrossed by tracers. SWOFF (V.0.) (cont'd) I went to war. And I am entitled to say: we belonged to 4 fucked situation.
